titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania LJS 478: Astronomical anthology

msContents.summary: Collection of astronomical treatises: Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Bīrūnī's Kitāb fī istīʻāb al-wujūh al-mumkina fī ṣanʻat al-asṭurlāb (On the construction of the astrolabe); 2 treatises on crab and drum astrolabes now attributed to the 10th-century astronomer Nasṭūlus (or Basṭūlus); a treatise on an instrument for finding the direction of Mecca; a treatise on the ecliptic; and a treatise on the compass.

supportDesc.extent: 87 leaves : 252 x 171 (190 x 124) mm. bound to 252 x 178 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i + 87 + i; [1-87]; some irregular foliation in ink, upper right verso.

decoDesc.decoNote: Numerous diagrams in red ink; title and heading words in red ink.

origin.p: Written in Persia or Anatolia, A.H. Jumadi II 625 (May 1228).

history.provenance: Sold by Sam Fogg Ltd. (London) to Lawrence J. Schoenberg, Apr. 2006.
Displayed by Sam Fogg Ltd. in Ink and Gold: Masterpieces of Islamic Calligraphy, at the Museum für Islamische Kunst, Berlin, July-Aug. 2006.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2011.
